ai:cl.c: Enables the application of lighting effects.

ai:a.c: Render the effect to the target bitmap.
ai:a.p: ERR acDraw(*Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Width, DOUBLE Height)

ai:i.c: The X position of the region to be drawn.
The Y position of the region to be drawn.
The width of the region to be drawn.
The height of the region to be drawn.

ai:m.c: Configure lighting with a distant light source.
ai:m.p: ERR lt::SetDistantLight(OBJECTPTR Object, DOUBLE Azimuth, DOUBLE Elevation)

ai:i.c: Direction angle for the light source on the XY plane (clockwise), in degrees from the X axis.
Direction angle for the light source from the XY plane towards the Z axis, in degrees. A positive value points towards the viewer of the content.

ai:m.c: Configure lighting with a pointed light source.
ai:m.p: ERR lt::SetPointLight(OBJECTPTR Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Z)

ai:i.c: X location for the light source.
Y location for the light source.
Z location for the light source.

ai:m.c: Configure lighting with a spot light source.
ai:m.p: ERR lt::SetSpotLight(OBJECTPTR Object, DOUBLE X, DOUBLE Y, DOUBLE Z, DOUBLE PX, DOUBLE PY, DOUBLE PZ, DOUBLE Exponent, DOUBLE ConeAngle)

ai:i.c: X location for the light source.
Y location for the light source.
Z location for the light source. The positive Z-axis comes out towards the person viewing the content and assuming that one unit along the Z-axis equals one unit in X and Y.
X location of the light source's target.
Y location of the light source's target.
Z location of the light source's target.
Exponent value controlling the focus for the light source.
A limiting cone which restricts the region where the light is projected, or 0 to disable. Specified in degrees.

ai:f.c: Defines the colour of the light source.
Specifies the ks/kd value in Phong lighting model.
Exponent for specular lighting, larger is more "shiny". Ranges from 1.0 to 128.0.
The maximum height of the input surface (bump map) when the alpha input is 1.0.
Defines the type of surface light scattering, which can be specular or diffuse.
The intended distance in current filter units for dx in the surface normal calculation formulas.
The intended distance in current filter units for dy in the surface normal calculation formulas.
Returns an SVG compliant XML string that describes the filter.
